results.title: Gently down the stream
results.creator_credit: Ray Costello and Education Department Western Australia
results.brief_description: Shows a Year 10 canoeing expedition on the river from Mt Franklin to the Noralup inlet, Western Australia. Demonstrates that the focus of the Outdoor Education Project is preparation for expeditions; and shows the basic understandings for wilderness and adventure activities.

results.title: Last man hanged
results.brief_description: This dramatised documentary depicts the events leading up to the hanging of Ronald Ryan in Pentridge Gaol in 1967 - the last man hanged in Australia. Through the eyes of Keith Willey (Lewis Fitz-Gerald), the journalist who followed the case, we see Ryan as a complex man who was as much a victim as those he had violated. This documentary details how the State Premier, Sir Henry Bolte, facing an imminent election, decided to make an issue of the case and pushed through the hanging despite nationwide protest. What evolves is powerful and emotional statement about capital punishment.

results.title: Handicap is something you put on a horse
results.creator_credit: Peter Brighton, Marjorie Fisher, Joan Reidy and I E A
results.brief_description: A documentation of the successful integration of a physically disabled person into the field of journalism. Stresses the importance of commencing the integration pocess at an early age and mantaining the integrated contact as the dissabled person matures.

results.title: Getting into jeans
results.creator_credit: Paul Wingate, Chris Strange, Ross D Wylie and AVCOM Productions
results.brief_description: Graeme (Shirley) Strachan presents an overview of the production of a pair of jeans from the beginning of the design process through to the sale to the customer. Shows the function of computers in laying out pattern pieces to the material available, the machinist at work, and the activity of wholesalers and retailers.

results.title: One drink away
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Geoff Owen-Taylor, Victoria. Ministry of Education and HSV7
results.brief_description: Looks closely at alcoholism within the community and the devastating effects it can have on the home and industry. The organizations set up to help alcoholics and their families are also discussed. Hosted by Dan Webb.

results.title: Damn it. B.Y.O.
results.brief_description: 1. “Damn it” (Sweden, 1980, 20 min.): An animated film showing the physical and emotional stresses experienced by a young man in a big city. 2. “BYO” (Brisbane, 1980, 19 min.): A dramatisation of a school dance where smuggling alcohol causes more trouble than it’s worth.

results.title: Going outside: to play, to imagine, to learn
results.creator_credit: Rick Cavaggion and Open College of Further Education (S. Aust.)
results.brief_description: Outlines ways in which teachers can develop children’s awareness of the natural environment. In a bush setting, five to eleven-year-olds role play the Dam Conflict Game, learning how to become involved in an issue and how to communicate their feelings.

results.title: Through a looking glass; Drama is -
results.creator_credit: Vincent O'Donnell and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Two drama education programs: “Through a looking glass” shows the major concepts underlaying drama in education and how the teacher can participate with the student in the dramatic process. “Drama is -” explores the ways in which drama can be used as a method to teach many subject areas.
